qas.question: What is the rejected duration of the Outright Monetary Transactions program?
When was the new idea for the purchasing of eurozone bonds declined?
How long was the duration of the Securities Markets Programme that never happened?

context: As of 18 June 2012, the ECB in total had spent <a0_0><b5_0>€212.1bn<b5_0/><a0_0/> (equal to 2.2% of the Eurozone GDP) for bond purchases covering outright debt, as part of its Securities Markets Programme (SMP) running since May 2010. On <a3_0><b8_0>6 September 2012<b8_0/><a3_0/>, the ECB announced a new plan for buying bonds from eurozone countries. The duration of the previous SMP was <a4_0><b9_0>temporary<b9_0/><a4_0/>, while the <a1_0><b6_0>Outright Monetary Transactions<b6_0/><a1_0/> (OMT) programme has <a2_0><b7_0>no ex-ante time or size limit<b7_0/><a2_0/>. On 4 September 2014, the bank went further by announcing it would buy bonds and other debt instruments primarily from banks in a bid to boost the availability of credit for businesses.
